com.bandyer.android_common.proximity_listener

Interface ProximitySensor


  • public ProximitySensor

    ProximitySensor is implemented as a boolean-sensor and works based on the lifecycle of the binded activity. It will be automatically unbinded on the activity destroy.

    It returns just two values "NEAR" or "FAR". Threshold is done on the LUX value i.e. the LUX value of the light sensor is compared with a threshold. A LUX-value more than the threshold means the proximity sensor returns "FAR". Anything less than the threshold value and the sensor returns "NEAR".

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Method to call when you are not interested in the ProximitySensor anymore. To re-enable the ProximitySensor after a destroy, the bind method must be called once again.
      long getDebounceMillis()
      Maximum debounce factor in millis for event reporting
      boolean isNear()
      Getter for last reported state. Set to true if "near" is reported.

    • Method Detail

      • getDebounceMillis

        long getDebounceMillis()

        Maximum debounce factor in millis for event reporting

      • isNear

        boolean isNear()

        Getter for last reported state. Set to true if "near" is reported.

        Returns:
        true for current near state, false otherwise

      • destroy

        void destroy()

        Method to call when you are not interested in the ProximitySensor anymore. To re-enable the ProximitySensor after a destroy, the bind method must be called once again.
